title: Klein Family Field
text:
Klein Family Field is a <a href="baseball">baseball</a> <a href="stadium">stadium</a> in <a href="Stockton%2C%20California">Stockton, California</a>. It is the home field of the <a href="University%20of%20the%20Pacific%20%28United%20States%29">University of the Pacific</a> Tigers <a href="college%20baseball">college baseball</a> team. The stadium holds 2,500 people and opened in 2006. Prior to the completion of Klein Family Field, the Tigers played home games at <a href="Billy%20Hebert%20Field">Billy Hebert Field</a> in Oak Park, Stockton, California. 
Location history.
Before the current baseball facility was built, the field's location was home to a <a href="American%20football">football</a> practice facility. Called Zuckerman Field, it was the practice field for the <a href="National%20Football%20League">National Football League</a>'s <a href="San%20Francisco%2049ers">San Francisco 49ers</a>, who held <a href="Training%20camp%20%28National%20Football%20League%29">training camp</a> at the <a href="University%20of%20the%20Pacific%20%28United%20States%29">University of the Pacific</a> from 1998 to 2002.
